channel.title: 508 server help plese!@!@@!@!@!@!@
channel.description:
when i click run on my cient it gets stuck on [ connecting updating server ] then i looked in help place and it says to rune ur server u need to rune server before cilent so i i went into my server files and in to CMD and i saw lots of run on the top rs2.cmd and some other cmds all the way on the bottom i saw run.cmd then i clicked it and it says CANNOT FIND THE PATH SPECIFIED CLICK ANY KEY TO CONTINUE and nothing happed i would have shown you some pics but i dont know how to instert it =p ago if i know how to put images in i would have
tell em and ill show i done that i put in it used to be
@echo off cd ../bin "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe" palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 pause
when i changed it it is
@echo off cd ../bin "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_11\bin\java.exe" palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 pause
and it still DONT WORK HELP i would have put in pics but dont know how =p
o yeah and i got jdk and jre
PLESE REPLY I WANT A SEREVRE REALLY BADLY TY FOR YOUR TIME
o yeah my chat room! http://xat.com/ownagek0

item.title: 508 server help plese!@!@@!@!@!@!@
item.dc:creator: @owner_37 owner 37
item.description:
@owner_37 wrote:

So Go to cmd files… click on run or allfiles.cmd and click edit…

now find youre jdk number… then change the one in there for that.

  1. still dont work? get a new source/client. m8

Read full topic

item.title: 508 server help plese!@!@@!@!@!@!@
item.dc:creator: @firewithin3 firewithin3
item.description:
@firewithin3 wrote:

Are you people blind? He clearly says that it says it can’t find the path specified, and the client can’t even run.

Read full topic

item.title: 508 server help plese!@!@@!@!@!@!@
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

if you get your server running, and the client running, and the client still gets stuck at connecting to update server, make sure you have the right cache, and the right updateKeys.

Read full topic

[quote=“Tatemo, post:2, topic:252794”]U need to get the 508 cache to make it work i know it is somewhere here i cant remember which thing i downloaded mine from if u want ill send u it[/quote]The cache has nothing to do with the command-prompt not being able to find the specified path…
